summary:
Heleen is an academic professional with expertise and experience in conducting research in the governance of environmental issues. She combines analytical skills with extensive communicative and organisational skills, gained from a former career as brand developer and project leader in the international marketing of fast moving consumer goods.

Heleen’s research interests are in urban governance issues, including topics such as: (shifts in) governance modes, divisions of responsibilities, democratic governance (legitimacy & accountability) and participation and coproduction of citizens. Her main empirical field of interest is climate change
governance. 

See also http://www.uu.nl/staff/HLPMees/

profile_positions.description:
Heleen's current research interests are in the roles of citizens in climate change governance. 

She teaches in various courses of the Master program 'Sustainable Development' and the Bachelor program 'Global Sustainability Science'.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: Heleen conducted research on community based bottom-up initiatives in (urban) climate change adaptation: how they emerge, how they perform, and how they could be upscaled to induce a societal transformation for climate change adaptation.This research was funded by JPI Climate and conducted in cooperation with the University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences (BOKU); Austria, the National University of Ireland Maynooth, Ireland; and the Université François-Rabelais, Ecole Polytechnique (CITERES), France.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher and Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Heleen conducted research on the governance of adaptation to climate change, as part of the Dutch Knowledge for Climate Research Programme. Her PhD thesis can be downloaded from http://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/301680.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate Knowledge for Climate Program
